segment.source: Release Notes for DaRT 7.0
segment.target: Release Notes for DaRT 7.0

segment.source: Release Notes for DaRT 7.0
segment.target: Release Notes for DaRT 7.0

segment.source: Release Notes for DaRT 7.0
segment.target: Release Notes for DaRT 7.0

segment.source: To search these release notes, press CTRL+F.
segment.target: To search these release notes, press CTRL+F.

segment.source: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 7.
segment.target: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 7.

segment.source: About Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset 7.0
segment.target: About Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset 7.0

segment.source: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install DaRT 7 and contain information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install DaRT 7 and contain information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a difference between these release notes and other DaRT platform documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a difference between these release notes and other DaRT platform documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: These release notes supersede the content included with this product.
segment.target: These release notes supersede the content included with this product.

segment.source: About the Product Documentation
segment.target: About the Product Documentation

segment.source: Documentation for Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 7 is distributed with the product and on the Connect site.
segment.target: Documentation for Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 7 is distributed with the product and on the Connect site.

segment.source: For detailed help about how to use the tools in DaRT 7, see the Help file available on the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset menu.
segment.target: For detailed help about how to use the tools in DaRT 7, see the Help file available on the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset menu.

segment.source: Providing feedback
segment.target: Providing feedback

segment.source: We are interested in your feedback on DaRT 7.
segment.target: We are interested in your feedback on DaRT 7.

segment.source: You can send your feedback to dart7feedback@microsoft.com.
segment.target: You can send your feedback to dart7feedback@microsoft.com.

segment.source: This email address is not a support channel, but your feedback will help us to plan future changes for these tools to make them more useful to you in the future.
segment.target: This email address is not a support channel, but your feedback will help us to plan future changes for these tools to make them more useful to you in the future.

segment.source: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses
segment.target: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses

segment.source: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, we recommend that you install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.
segment.target: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, we recommend that you install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.

segment.source: For more information, see Microsoft Security (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).
segment.target: For more information, see Microsoft Security (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).

segment.source: Known Issues with DaRT 7.0
segment.target: Known Issues with DaRT 7.0

segment.source: SFC Scan cannot start if Standalone System Sweeper is open
segment.target: SFC Scan cannot start if Standalone System Sweeper is open

segment.source: If the Standalone System Sweeper is running, SFC Scan cannot start or run because of a resource conflict between the two tools.
segment.target: If the Standalone System Sweeper is running, SFC Scan cannot start or run because of a resource conflict between the two tools.

segment.source: Workaround: Close the Standalone System Sweeper before you try to open or run the SFC Scan tool.
segment.target: Workaround: Close the Standalone System Sweeper before you try to open or run the SFC Scan tool.

segment.source: Unicode characters may not be displayed in file names
segment.target: Unicode characters may not be displayed in file names

segment.source: If you delete a file that has Unicode characters in its file name and try to restore the file by using the File Restore tool, the file is not found.
segment.target: If you delete a file that has Unicode characters in its file name and try to restore the file by using the File Restore tool, the file is not found.

segment.source: This only occurs when you use characters from a language other than the language of the Windows DVD that was used to create the recovery image.
segment.target: This only occurs when you use characters from a language other than the language of the Windows DVD that was used to create the recovery image.

segment.source: Workaround: Make sure that the language that is used by DaRT matches the language that is used by the operating system from which it is trying to restore files.
segment.target: Workaround: Make sure that the language that is used by DaRT matches the language that is used by the operating system from which it is trying to restore files.

segment.source: DaRT command-line installation may fail silently
segment.target: DaRT command-line installation may fail silently

segment.source: DaRT command-line installation fails silently if run with the quiet mode option unless it is run by using elevated administrator permissions.
segment.target: DaRT command-line installation fails silently if run with the quiet mode option unless it is run by using elevated administrator permissions.

segment.source: Workaround: Run the command-line installation by using elevated administrator permissions.
segment.target: Workaround: Run the command-line installation by using elevated administrator permissions.

segment.source: DaRT installation supports the typical Windows Installer options for command-line installation.
segment.target: DaRT installation supports the typical Windows Installer options for command-line installation.

segment.source: Please see Command-Line Options for Windows Installer for more information about the several available switches.
segment.target: Please see Command-Line Options for Windows Installer for more information about the several available switches.

segment.source: File Search cannot move a folder to a different volume
segment.target: File Search cannot move a folder to a different volume

segment.source: Moving folders between volumes is not supported by the File Search application.
segment.target: Moving folders between volumes is not supported by the File Search application.

segment.source: If you try to move a folder to a different volume in File Search, the following error is returned: "An error occurred while writing the file filename.
segment.target: If you try to move a folder to a different volume in File Search, the following error is returned: "An error occurred while writing the file filename.

segment.source: Make sure that the drive has sufficient space and the destination path is accessible."
segment.target: Make sure that the drive has sufficient space and the destination path is accessible."

segment.source: Workaround: Use the Explorer to move a folder to a different volume.
segment.target: Workaround: Use the Explorer to move a folder to a different volume.

segment.source: Some data may not be available on computers where the drive letters are remapped
segment.target: Some data may not be available on computers where the drive letters are remapped

segment.source: This problem can occur on BitLocker-enabled computers and multiboot computers.
segment.target: This problem can occur on BitLocker-enabled computers and multiboot computers.

segment.source: This occurs because some information in the offline registry has hard-coded drive letters, and DaRT uses different letters for the same volumes.
segment.target: This occurs because some information in the offline registry has hard-coded drive letters, and DaRT uses different letters for the same volumes.

segment.source: The typical effects include not having access to certain local user accounts in Registry Editor.
segment.target: The typical effects include not having access to certain local user accounts in Registry Editor.

segment.source: Additionally, some tools may be unable to obtain properties that rely on resolving file paths.
segment.target: Additionally, some tools may be unable to obtain properties that rely on resolving file paths.

segment.source: Workaround: Use the option to remap the drive letters as DaRT starts.
segment.target: Workaround: Use the option to remap the drive letters as DaRT starts.

segment.source: This usually aligns the typical drive letters to what is expected.
segment.target: This usually aligns the typical drive letters to what is expected.

segment.source: Hotfix Uninstall might not uninstall certain updates
segment.target: Hotfix Uninstall might not uninstall certain updates

segment.source: Some updates and service packs cannot be uninstalled because they are marked as un-installable or because they need to be uninstalled from within Windows 7.
segment.target: Some updates and service packs cannot be uninstalled because they are marked as un-installable or because they need to be uninstalled from within Windows 7.

segment.source: In these instances, the Hotfix Uninstall tool may indicate that these updates have been uninstalled even though they have not been.
segment.target: In these instances, the Hotfix Uninstall tool may indicate that these updates have been uninstalled even though they have not been.

segment.source: Workaround: Uninstall these problematic updates from Windows 7.
segment.target: Workaround: Uninstall these problematic updates from Windows 7.

segment.source: Disk Wipe: Disks with spanned volumes, striped volumes, or mirrored volumes cannot be deleted
segment.target: Disk Wipe: Disks with spanned volumes, striped volumes, or mirrored volumes cannot be deleted

segment.source: Disk Wipe does not support deleting disks that are spanned, mirrored, or striped across one or more volumes.
segment.target: Disk Wipe does not support deleting disks that are spanned, mirrored, or striped across one or more volumes.

segment.source: Workaround: Select and delete each disk in the volume separately.
segment.target: Workaround: Select and delete each disk in the volume separately.
